origin_of_ch_char_book: The ancient Chinese considered that there were five essential elements in the universe: Water (Ê∞¥, shui), Fire (ÁÅ´, huo), Wood (Êú®, mu), Iron (Èáë, jin), and Earth (Âúü, tu). The five main elements interact and create each other or restrain each other. For example, the tree burns and creates fire which burns down to ashes and becomes earth (soil). Water restrains fire and fire can melt metal. (‰∫î, wu, five) contains such philosophical meanings. The top line means sky , the bottom line is earth , and the middle shows how the ‚Äúfive elements‚Äù cross and interact with each other.
humanum_full_description_en:
Jia Jin inscription and seal inscription have the same configuration, and the original meaning is unknown. Xu Shen thinks that the characters are like the cross between heaven and earth, Zhu Fangpu said from it. After more than a few people on loan. "Said Wen": "Five, the five elements. From two, yin and yang are in the heaven and the earth at noon. All the belongings of the five are from five. Yi, the five provinces in ancient Chinese."

The original meaning of " Five " is unknown. In one case, it is said that the characters are engraved with symbols to represent the numeral " Five " (Yu Shengwu). One said that the " five " is like a rope-retracting device, and it is the original text of " mutual " (Ding Shan). See " mutual ". Because Yu Shengwu believed that the " Yi " and five horizontal paintings seen in the Shang Dynasty pottery and oracle bone inscriptions were both " five ", Zhang Bingquan proposed that the five horizontal paintings were like five fingers extending horizontally, and because the five fingers extended horizontally, palm prints were visible. Therefore, the " Yi " shape is used to represent the palm prints; later, the word " Five " is to add a horizontal line above and below the " Yi " shape, and there are lines in the elephant palm to indicate the number " five ". Ji Xusheng thinks that the five horizontal paintings are "quan (four)" plus a pen, not the word " five ", so this seems to be untenable.

The oracle " five " is used as a numeral or as a base number, "Compilation" 14316: "§â≤(Ááé) in the east, five dogs, five sheep", refers to the sacrifice of five dogs and five sheep in the east. . Or as an ordinal number, "Collection" 6: "May." Oracle has the term "five clans", which refers to a kind of military organization, "Collection" 28054: "five clans."

Bronze inscriptions are also used as numerals. Yin Xianqian: "Yi (gives) five grades of jade." Xun: "Today's amnesty girl (ru), whip girl (ru) five hundred." Also used as an ordinal number, the fifth division [„´ÉÂè≤]£™ï: "Yu (Only) King's fifth year in September, the birth of the tyrant Renwu." The word "five days" is also common in inscriptions, referring to the sun, moon and stars pattern on the flag. Wang Chen: "Fifth day of the flag." In 1935, the inscription on the land attack was unearthed in Shanbiao Town, Jixian County, Henan Province. On the right side of the design is a large flag with five circles, which is called "Five Days" (Zhang Zhenghong).

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were used as numerals, "Shangbo Bamboo Book One. "Cheng Yi" Jane 14: "Miao people are not yong (use) Èúù (spirit), fold (make) „†Ø (take) type (punishment), Èöπ (only) zha (make) the type of five precepts (punishment) called law." The whole sentence points out that the Miao people‚Äôs monarch refused to do good, and used punishment to punish the people, and formulated five brutal penalties, which were considered laws. The word is also used as a place name, "Tsinghua Jane II. Jane 41-42: "Jin Wengong Siqi and Song Zhide, and Qin È†Ç (teacher) Hui (wei) Cao and Wulu, fought against Wei to escape the Qi defense and Song Zhihui (wei)." "Left pass. Twenty-eight years of Gong Xi: "Wushen in the first month, take five deer."

Qin Jian in the " five " read into " Wu ", "Shuihudi Jane. Closed clinic. "You Diao" Jane 6: "Shiwu (Wu) Jumuli." "Historical Records. "Qin Benji": "In October of the fiftieth year, Wu'an Jun became guilty and became a member of the army and moved to the shadows." "Ji Jie" quoted Ru Chun as saying: "Taking a nobleman and seizing a nobleman by sin is called. Shiwu." "Shiwu" refers to a person who once had a knighthood but was deprived of the title due to sin. Also " five " can be read as " language ", referring to words, "Sleeping Tiger Land. Japanese Book Yi Zong Jian 240: "Ding Chousheng, good words (language)."

" Five " in Mawangdui silk script can be read as " I ", used as the first-person pronoun, "Mawangdui silk script. The 15th line of "Lao Zi Jiaben": "Five (I) is based on knowing nothing and doing [the existence] benefit."

Several names, four plus one (usually capitalized "wu" on banknotes and receipts): colorful. Five senses. Grain. Hardware. Five Dynasties (names of Chinese dynasties, the period when Hou Liang, Hou Tang, Hou Jin, Hou Han, and Hou Zhou successively established political power in the Central Plains). Five Emperors (five emperors in Chinese legends, usually referred to as Huangdi, Zhuanxu, Di Yu, Tang Yao, and Yu Shun). Five poisons (referring to scorpions, snakes, centipedes, geckos, toads). The five elements (referring to gold, wood, water, fire, and earth). Wuling (referring to Yuechengling, Dupangling, Mengzhuling, Qitianling, and Dayuling). Five Mountains (referring to Dongyue Taishan, Xiyue Huashan, Nanyue Hengshan, Beiyue Hengshan and Zhongyue Songshan, which are the five famous mountains in Chinese history). Five internal organs (referring to heart, liver, spleen, lung and kidney).
The notation of Chinese ancient music score is equivalent to "6" in numbered musical notation.
